resources.string: HS-Ulm New Student Info App
Open navigation drawer
Close navigation drawer
Settings
Earning money during your studies\n

There are many ways of earning money while you study, for example as waiting staff, academic assistants or private tutors. A knowledge of German will improve your chances of finding a part-time job. But please be aware of the legal regulations.
\nSearching for a job:

The regional offices of the Federal Employment Agency often have a job exchange for students. At larger higher education institutions you can find job vacancy listings at student services. Online job exchanges can be found on the websites of higher education institutions and student services. Sometimes a look at the notice board at your higher education institution or the classified ads in the local and regional papers is sufficient .
\nAcademic assistants:

Some students work as academic assistants at their university. They may for example supervise the library, lead tutorials or research literature for professors. Academic assistant jobs are a good addition to a degree programme. If you are interested in one of these jobs, you should ask about vacancies at the administrative office of your institute and keep an eye on the notice boards at your higher education institution.
\nOutside your higher education institution:

Typical off-campus student jobs include waiting tables, working at trade fairs, babysitting and courier services. Teacher training students often give tuition, students in publishing work for newspapers: the ideal job will be in some way associated with your degree programme.\n
Important:

It is virtually impossible for students to fund their entire cost of living through side jobs. There are not very many jobs of this type for students on the German labour market – and working too much can needlessly extend your degree programme. Instead, we recommend that you make use of the recess period and ensure that you are financially secure through scholarships or with the help of your family.\n
Tips:

At Hochschule Ulm, there is a year event "Karriere Börse" normally during the last week of October. Students get the opportunity to meet and interact with their favorite companies. Job/internship searching students are strongly advised to visit the event, make direct job applications and ask questions directly.\n
Job Links:
Some of the job links can be found below. You are strongly advised to also use some search engines e.g Google to make your search
https://studierendenwerk-ulm.de/en/bafoeg-and-finances/part-time-work/
https://de.indeed.com/
https://www.arbeitsagentur.de/en/welcome
https://www.jobmensa.de/
\nHow much are you allowed to work?

As of August 2012 international students who do not come from the EU or EEA are allowed to work 120 full or 240 half days in a year. To do this they do not need authorisation from the Employment Agency, i.e. the German authorities. 

International students who do not come from the EU cannot go self employed or work freelance! 

If you want to work more than 120 full or 240 half days you need the approval of the Employment Agency and the Aliens Department. Whether you receive the approval depends on the situation of the job market in your place of study. In regions with high unemployment you will have little chance of working more than 120 days. 

One exception, however, is the occupation of academic or student assistant. As long as your studies are not impaired by it, this work can be carried out for an unlimited period of time. The Aliens Department must still be informed if you wish to work as an academic or student assistant!
\nStudents from the EU and the EEA\n

Basically students from the European Union and the EEA stand practically on equal terms with German students and have free access to the German job market. You are regarded as a regular student and not as an employee if your job during term time contains no more than 20 hours a week. Since Mai 2011 students from Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Slovakia, Slovenia, Czech Republic and Hungary can work in terms similar to the German students.
MainActivity

string.name: city_laws
string.br: In Germany there are strict laws which every resident must abide to.These laws varies between several sectors\n
1.parking laws\nclick on this link for parking laws in ulm https://www.parken-in-ulm.de\n
2.rundfunkbeitrag\nThere is usually a fee for Radio and Television services in Germany click on this link for more info https://www.rundfunkbeitrag.de\n
3.Illegal downloading of movies in Germany\n for more info click on this link https://www.evz.de/en/consumer-topics/illegal-downloading-in-germany\n
4.Tax classes and laws\nYou can find here informations about the different tax classes in Germany https://steuerklassen.biz/ \n

5. The Finanzamt is responsible for taxed related issues .Recalaimation of taxes for the previous year is done mostly in the first Quater of the following year. https://fa-ulm.fv-bwl.de/pb/,Lde/Startseite \n

string.name: funding
string.br: In Germany these are some scholarships and funding schemes available for students \n
1.Bafög\nThis funding scheme is available to students from the European union. click for more info https://www.bafög.de\n
2.Konrad Adenauer stiftung scholarship \nThis is a scholarship scheme for international students. click for more info https://www.kas.de/who-are-we-looking-for-en-\n

3.Kofi Annan MBA scholarship for developing countries \n This is a scholarship scheme for students from develping countries. click for more info https://www.esmt.org/degree-programs/fees-and-financing/mba-scholarships\n

4.Daad scholarship for Development related post-graduate courses\n A scholarship for post graduate studies. click for more info https://www.daad.de/der-daad/unsere-aufgaben/entwicklungszusammenarbeit/foerderprogramme/hochschulen/infos/en/45192-development-related-postgraduate-courses-epos\n
5.Erasmus Mundus Scholarship for international students\n For European and non European citizens .click for more info https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/sites/2007-2013/archiving\n

resources.string: Transport Connections:

\nThe Ulm University of Applied Sciences is ideally connected to local and national transport links.The Donau-Iller-Nahverkehrsbund-GmbH (DING) organises local public transport in and around Ulm. With your student ID card, you can travel for free on public transport throughout the entire DING region, on weekdays from 6 pm and all day at the weekend or on bank holidays. What is more, your ID card gives you free bus travel between the stops "Örlinger Straße" and "Egertweg" (Line 4). This means, as a Ulm University of Applied Sciences​ student, you can travel for free between the Prittwitzstrasse campus and our site in Böfingen. \nWhen you start the first semester of your studies at the Ulm University of Applied Sciences​ and register your main residence as being in Ulm, you will receive a semester ticket for the DING region free of charge. For all subsequent semesters, the DING semester ticket for the entire network currently costs 116.50 € and is valid for one semester.
\nYou can get the semester ticket at the:
http://www.servicecenter-neue-mitte.de/swu-traffiti.html
\nYou can find all other information about transport and the DING local and regional transport network at:
https://www.ding.eu/
\nIf you need to commute beyond the boundaries of the DING network, the neighbouring public transport companies offer inexpensive connecting semester tickets:
https://www.naldo.de/tickets-und-preise/alle-fahrscheine/anschluss-semestertickets/
https://www.bodo.de/tickets/fahrscheine-preise.html
https://www.filsland.de/tickets-und-preise/student/anschluss-studiticket

resources.string: Semester Plan

At the beginning of the semester, new coming students have an opportunity to download thier semester plan of their program. Semester plan provides information about the courses which are placed for actual semeset. Link to download actual semester plan: \n https://www.hs-ulm.de/Dienste/Stundenplan/Studienanfänger/ \n

Moreover, there is also possible to download induvidual semeter plan for the higher course students according to the subjects of their preference.Link to download indivudial actual semester plan: \n https://lsf.verwaltung.hs-ulm.de/ \n

All courses offered in this actual semester. Link to the list of couses offered : \n https://lsf.verwaltung.hs-ulm.de/ \n After getting logged into system, there is section: Mein Studiengangplan. You need to just click onto it.

Detailed information about all the courses chosen by student for that semester. \n https://lsf.verwaltung.hs-ulm.de/ \n After getting logged into system, there is section: Meine Veranstaltungen. You need to just click onto it.

All the important dates during the academic year at Hochschule Ulm including national holidays, semester break as well as exam periods. Link provides all the important dates for the actual semester: \n https://studium.hs-ulm.de/en/Pages/Termine.aspx \n
FAQ
Frequently asked questions:
1. How to find the course in Germany?

Find the suitable course of study! In the database there are more than 17500 courses for Bachelor, Master and State Examination. \n https://www.daad.de/deutschland/studienangebote/international-programmes/en/detail/4669/
2. How do I apply for CTS course?

We are delighted you are interested in the degree programme Computer Science (CTS). We hope the following link will help you successfully secure a place at our University of Applied Sciences. \n https://studium.hs-ulm.de/de/Seiten/Studiengang_CTS_Bewerbung.aspx/
3. Different application forms for all the informatics faculty?
In the following link given below you will get all application form. \n http://www.hs-ulm.de/informatik-downloads/
4. What steps do I have to take after admission?

The German embassy in your country will inform you about the details of visa application as they apply to your country. If you need a visa, please apply immediately after receiving the admission letter. Be aware that the visa procedure will take several weeks/. \n https://studium.hs-ulm.de/de/Seiten/Studiengang_CTS_Bewerbung.aspx/
5. How do I apply for CTS course?

We are delighted you are interested in the degree programme Computer Science (CTS). We hope the following link will help you successfully secure a place at our University of Applied Sciences. \n https://studium.hs-ulm.de/de/Seiten/Studiengang_CTS_Bewerbung.aspx/
6. How to get to Ulm?

The railway station (Hauptbahnhof) is in the town center, about a 10 minute walk from the church (Ulmer Münster). Ulm is about an hour from Stuttgart and 1.5-2 hours from Munich.more information if you need you will get the link below. \n https://www.uni-ulm.de/en/io/degree-phd/welcome/getting-around/to-ulm
8. How to get Semesterplan?
In the following link given below you will get the Semesterplan. \n https://lsf.verwaltung.hs-ulm.de/
9. How to find Mensa plan?
In the following link given below you will get the mensa plan. \n https://studium.hs-ulm.de/de/Seiten/Mensa.aspx/
10.How to find Room Plan?
In the following link given below you will get room plan. \n https: //lsf.verwaltung.hs-ulm.de/
11. Here you can enroll, un-enroll from subjects and examinations, check your grades, search for other modules, and more.?

Normally from first to third semester you will be automatically register for the exam. from third semester you have to register one week before the lecture started.if you don\t want to continue any course or don\t want to take any exam you have to deregister one month before the exam. In the following link given below you will get more information. \n https://lsf.verwaltung.hs-ulm.de/qisserver/rds?state=usertype=0/
12. How to find Mensa plan?
In the following link given below you will get the mensa plan. \n https://studium.hs-ulm.de/de/Seiten/Mensa.aspx/
13. Where do I get Examination plans?
Normally One month before exam plan in uploaded in the following link that given below . \n http://www.hs-ulm.de/Fakultaet/Informatik/Prüfungen/
14. Where I can get the Academic Calendar?
In the following link given below you will get the Academic Calendar. \n https://studium.hs-ulm.de/de/Seiten/Termine.aspx/
15. Access to the university email from browser?

Every student assigned one email ID by HS Ulm. Normally all information regarding University you will get from this email.In the following link given below you will get the domain ID for email. \n https: //webmail.hs-ulm.de/
16.Students’ union?
In the following link given below you will get the student Union update. \n https://studium.hs-ulm.de/de/Seiten/Verfasste_Studierendenschaft.aspx/
17.DreamSpark Webstore for informatics faculty (Important Software)?

In the following link given below you will get important software that you need. \n https://e5.onthehub.com/WebStore/ProductsByMajorVersionList.aspx?cmi_cs=1cmi_mnuMain=d36a65f7-6fcf-e111-971c-f04da23e67f6ws=1e06aec9-836f-e011-971f-0030487d8897vsro=8/
Hostel

Most international students live in one of the dorms. Information about student housing are available here.There are two types of Hostel for Student.Private and public.The Studierendenwerk Ulm lease rooms in several residential homes in Ulm. Rooms are usually rented out for at least one semester (6 months). There are bus connections to all universities and the city centre from all residential homes. The best time to submit the application is around 3 months before your intended arrival. Moving in is only possible from Monday to Friday, i.e. if you arrive on a Friday afternoon, a Saturday or a Sunday, you will have to wait until Monday morning. The rooms of the student residences are mostly inhabited until the last day of the contract period. Therefore, you often cannot move in until the first day of your contract. More information how to get hostel are found bellow..."?
